TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ListDecoration extends System.Enum

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of decoration to be added to list items. This class cannot be inherited. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration> enumeration represents how you will specify decoration for a list, as bullets, numbers, or no decoration at all. In ASP.NET, you specify the type of decoration for a list by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.Decoration%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration Bulleted = int32(1)

Docs.summary: List items are decorated with a bullet. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: No decoration. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration Numbered = int32(2)

Docs.summary: List items are decorated with a number. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
